title: Debunking the Idyllic View of Natural Processes: Population Dynamics and Suffering in the Wild
excerpt: Debunking the Idyllic View of Natural Processes: Population Dynamics and Suffering in the Wild
subtitle: Debunking the Idyllic View of Natural Processes: Population Dynamics and Suffering in the Wild.
abstract: The most comprehensive academic paper arguing for the net suffering over enjoyment in the wild and defending its moral importance.™

title: The Importance of Wild Animal Suffering
subtitle: The Importance of Wild Animal Suffering.
abstract: A comprehensive overall summary which makes the case that there is a massive amount of net animal suffering in the wild. The author argues that reducing wild animal suffering in the far future should be our number one ethical priority.

title: Filling the Ark: Animal Welfare in Disasters
excerpt: Filling the Ark: Animal Welfare in Disasters
subtitle: Filling the Ark: Animal Welfare in Disasters.
abstract: A sociological study into the impact disasters have on animals, including companion animals, farmed animals, birds and marine wildlife, and animals used in research. The study finds that most risks faced by animals are human-caused, and as such can be changed to prevent animal suffering in disasters.
